topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556fe94c636872357b980200#post_556fe94c636872357b980200
[bq="Number1pegasus"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556fe8af6368722c32f20700#post_556fe8af6368722c32f20700
If this happens I'll be fucking happy as hell! [/bq]
I may be biased towards pc gaming, but sorry console fans; because digital distribution is getting so cheap vs hard copies of games I really don't doubt the next generation of gaming will have a game disc.  In all probability they will be digital download *only*.

You may personally hate the idea of this, but if does happen then the cost of video game production will be reduced enough to usher in a new golden age of gaming.

Cons: No more game discs
Pros: Drastically reduced costs for companies

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556feb146368722c32e30b00#post_556feb146368722c32e30b00
I like it would be cheaper.

_but_, I do enjoy having my physical copies of my games. If there is anything I hate its the probability that my games or something that I own can easily be wiped out.

Or worse something could happen to them like what happened to PT and a lot of other Digital titles that got destroyed. 

For Me Physical copies are nicer just because it guarantees I will always have them on hand. And not worry about something stupid and shitty happening and than I have to waste my money again.

topics.body:
You know what I want?
More horror crossovers. Because say what you will about Freddy vs. Jason, that movie delivered on the hype it promised. Gimme things like Ash Williams from Evil Dead taking on the Cenobites with his chainsaw and BOOMSTICK. I wanna see Chuckey and Leprachaun see who can be more of a little evil bastard while fighting the puppets from Puppet Master. I want dumb, goofy, hype shit with horror and slasher icons. I know these things are never gonna happen because movie studios are run by morons who can't even COMPREHEND the idea of sharing profits 50/50. And as James Rolf himself said, fifty percent is still more than nothing which is what they're making now.
